findings.title: Improper Logic of StargateBorrow::borrowETH()
findings.description: The borrowETH() routine in StargateBorrow contract has an improper logic which ignores that router.swap() cannot support native token (i.e., ETH) cross-chain transfer, resulting in transaction reversion.

findings.title: Revisited Bridge Fee Calculation in RadiantOFT::_getBridgeFee()
findings.description: The `_getBridgeFee()` routine needs improvement to properly calculate the bridge fee during cross-chain token transfers.

findings.title: Revisited Withdrawal Amount Calculation in MultiFeeDistribution::exit()
findings.description: The `MultiFeeDistribution` contract's `exit()` function has an incorrect implementation of withdrawal amount calculation, resulting in unexpected earnings for users.

findings.title: Possible Price Manipulation for UniswapPoolHelper::getPrice()/getLpPrice()
findings.description: The getPrice() routine in UniswapPoolHelper contract is vulnerable to price manipulation due to the derivation of RDNT token price from wethReserve and rdntReserve, which can be manipulated.

findings.title: Possible Sandwich/MEV Attacks for Reduced Returns
findings.description: The `claimAndSwapToBase()` function is vulnerable to possible front-running attacks due to lack of slippage control.

findings.title: Possible Overflow/Underflow Prevention with SafeMath
findings.description: The current implementation can be improved with the use of `SafeMath` to prevent common overflow or underflow issues when working with `uint256` operands.
findings.contract: Multiple Contracts (including ChefIncentivesController, MultiFeeDistribution, RadiantOFT, LzApp, Disqualifier)

findings.title: Trust Issue of Admin Keys
findings.description: In the Radiant V2 protocol, there is a privileged `owner` account that plays a critical role in governing and regulating system-wide operations.
